feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically calculates and deducts daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave. It determines the appropriate salary reduction by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for public holidays by deducting them from the working days total. The feature supports both calendar day-based and working day-based leave policies. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the system automatically generates a pay deduction reflected on the payroll table.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month.
Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages to determine salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts with greater control and accuracy.
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations, including selection of salary components and calculation methods.
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations.
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration.
Super Admins who configure leave policies and payroll settings
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure.
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist before daily pay deduction is calculated and reflected on the payroll table.
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to exclude weekends and public holidays from working days calculations.
Super admin role with access to payroll settings and end-of-service configuration.
Access to Leave Settings configuration as a Super Admin; ability to add a new leave policy
Super admin role required to access and modify salary proration settings

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary amount (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days or calendar days in the month based on the leave policy, and public holidays falling in the calculation month.

Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and selection of salary components to factor into calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).
Selection of salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and eligible leave types for encashment configuration.
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, calculated daily pay rate, and deduction reflected on the payroll table.
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and visibility of which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten.
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation method that applies daily deductions to monthly employee payroll
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes apply to all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve the leave request, determine the applicable leave policy (calendar days or working days), calculate total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary by actual working days, and generate the payroll deduction.

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select the calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to include in the calculation.

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and save the new proration settings again.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay formula: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) / Number of actual working days in the month. The number of days can be calendar days (e.g., 30 days) if following calendar days leave policy or working days (e.g., 22 days) if following working days leave policy. Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from working days to arrive at actual working days used in the calculation.

Calculation base options are limited to calendar days (total days in the month), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (company-defined, commonly 30 days for UAE and KSA compliance with labor law). The selected calculation base directly impacts salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts.

Salary component selection limited to Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method options are calendar days, working days, or custom days. Configuration applies to eligible paid leave types for end-of-service encashment.
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay; Super Admins have flexibility to choose from multiple calculation and day type options

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject the transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be considered and subtracted from the working days total when calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 days are public holidays and the leave policy is based on 22 working days, daily pay is calculated on 20 days (22 minus 2), not the full 22 days.

Calendar days vary by month (e.g., January has 31 days, February has 28 days), which affects daily wage calculations. Different calculation methods (calendar vs. working vs. custom days) produce different wage rates and must be selected carefully to align with company policy and labor law requirements.
Super admins can view which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten by the new leave encashment configuration to prevent unintended policy changes.
Multiple configuration options are available for daily rate calculation, including Basic Only and Basic + Allowances, each producing different deduction amounts
When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, Super admin must manually reject and resave those transactions to apply new salary proration settings

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: Interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions, and connects with leave management system for unpaid leave request approval and employee record systems for salary information.

The Daily Wage Calculator directly impacts three main areas: Salary proration, Leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction. It integrates with the company's public holiday calendar to determine working days and interacts with payroll settings and leave management systems.
Interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies affecting end-of-service benefit calculations.
Interacts with the payroll system by calculating daily deductions that are applied to monthly employee pay; related to leave encashment configuration
Interacts with Payroll system and affects active payroll table transactions; impacts employee first salary and end-of-service settlement calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary rate used to deduct unpaid leave days from an employee's salary, computed as total salary divided by actual working days. Working days: The number of business days in a month, excluding weekends and public holidays. Calendar days: The total number of days in a month (e.g., 30 days) used as the basis for leave calculation under calendar day-based leave policies. Public holidays: Days recognized as official holidays that are excluded from working day calculations.

Calendar days: the total number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February). Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays set up on the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days: a flexible calculation base set by payroll table managers according to company policies, commonly 30 days for UAE and KSA labor law compliance.

Leave encashment: The conversion of unused leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: The final settlement of employee benefits upon termination or separation. Daily Wage Calculator: Configuration tool for customizing leave encashment calculations.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without compensation; Daily rate calculation: Method of computing deductions based on daily wages; Basic Only: Calculation method using only base salary; Basic + Allowances: Calculation method including base salary and allowances; Calendar days: Day calculation type counting all days; Working days: Day calculation type counting only business days; Custom days: Day calculation type with user-defined parameters

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): System component for configuring salary proration. Salary Proration: Method of calculating proportional salary based on days worked. Calculation bases: custom days, calendar days, or working days—the three methods available for determining prorated salary amounts.
